choices.D: configuring the default Ethernet system class to an MTU of 9216 with a new network QoS policy map
choices.A: changing the default policy map from a default MTU of 1500 to 9216

questions.question_text: Enabling jumbo frame support on a Cisco Nexus 5500 Switch can be done through which method?

discussion.content:
yes:
Network QoS MTU Configuration
Nexus 3000: Includes Nexus 3048, 3064, 3132Q, 3132Q-X, 3132Q-XL, 3172, and 3500 Series switches

Nexus 5000: All Nexus 5000 and 5500 Series switches

Nexus 6000: All Nexus 6000 Series switches

In order to configure elevated MTU on these switches, create a network-qos policy or modify an existing policy in order to specify the elevated MTU. This configuration applies to all ports. This includes any Cisco Fabric Extender (FEX) ports connected to the switch. Per-port MTU is not supported.

questions.question_text: Which three statements about ACI border leaf are true? (Choose three.)

choices.D: The border leaves are dedicated leaf switches that support only Layer 2 and Layer 3 out in an ACI fabric.
choices.B: There can only be 2 border leaves in an ACI fabric. The first two leaves that are discovered in an ACI fabric are always selected as border leaves.
choices.E: The border leaf can also be used to connect to compute, IP storage, and service appliances.
choices.C: The border leaves are ACI leaves that provide Layer 3 connections to outside networks.
choices.A: Only 32 border leaves are supported in an ACI fabric.

discussion.content: B is wrong for sure, but I cannot identify the 3rd correct answer.

Which two statements about SAN port channels configured on Cisco Nexus 5000 Series switches are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: The protocol ensures that a set of ports are eligible to be part of the same SAN port channel. They are only eligible to be part of the same port channel if all the ports have a compatible partner.
The switch software provides robust error detection and synchronization capabilities. You can manually configure channel groups, or they can be automatically created.

choices.D: The port channel protocol uses the exchange fabric parameters command to communicate " across peer ports in an ISL.
choices.A: The bring up protocol automatically detects and overrides any misconfiguration.
choices.B: You can manually configure channel groups, or they can be automatically created.
choices.C: Changes in configuration to the SAN port channel interface must also be made to all members of the channel group.
choices.E: The port channel protocol ensures that a set of ports is eligible to be part of the same SAN port channel.

choices.D: support for Data Center Service Modules

questions.question_text: Which three capabilities make the Cisco Nexus 7010 switch an effective solution for the data center core? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
agree
High availability and redundancy

The fabrics support multilevel redundancy, where all available fabrics are active, and provide redundancy for all other fabric modules. All I/O module slots receive a fair share of the total fabric bandwidth, helping ensure lossless forwarding in the event of failover.

Scalable fabric

The combined fabric modules deliver 10 channels per I/O module and 5 channels per supervisor module, for a scalable capacity of more than 8 Tbps for forwarding performance, which can be increased as your needs grow.
